datafield.subfield: Shelfmark: Ann Arbor, University of Michigan, Special Collections Library, Isl. Ms. 518
Origin: Lacks dated colophon ; collation statement on p.203 provides a rough terminus ante quem of 1708 ; paper, etc. suggest mid to late 17th or early 18th century dating.
Accompanying materials: a. Acquisitions slip from Yahuda (pp.1-2) -- b. Portion of a page from a printed book (in Turkish, possibly from a book catalogue) (pp.3-4).
Former shelfmark: From inner front cover, "M. 15" (likely supplied by Yahuda, see acquisitions slip).

Binding: Pasteboards covered in light pink laid paper with spine, fore edge flap, and fore edge of upper board in dark red leather ; Type II binding (with flap) ; board linings in untinted European laid paper (watermarks visible) ; sewn in white thread, two stations, many threads broken ; worked endbands in yellow and light blue over red leather core, fair condition thought with losses exposing core ; overall in somewhat poor condition with significant abrasion, staining, lifting and losses of paper and leather, flap detaching, delamination of boards, etc.

Support: European laid paper of two main types ; opening type with 6-7 laid lines per cm. (vertical), chain lines spaced 23-25 mm. apart (horizontal), and three crescents watermark (80 mm. long, perpendicular to chains, see p.12, 34, etc.), well-burnished to glossy, thick and sturdy, fairly crisp ; another type with 9-10 laid lines per cm. (vertical), chain lines spaced 28 mm. apart (horizontal), and hand / glove watermark (see p.90, compare nos. 11 and 12 in Velkov, Les Filigranes dans les documents Ottoman), thinner and far less glossy.

Decoration: Keywords and section headings rubricated in some texts ; overlining in red ; textual dividers in the form of red discs ; hāʼ musalsalah of قوله in quite ornate flourishes in red (see p.15, etc.).

Script: Naskh ; at least two hands, possibly Egyptian [?] in narrow and bolder lines ; one more angular, cramped and compact ; the other larger and more elegant ; mainly serifless (though occasional serifs irregularly appear) with effect of tilt to the left, elongation of horizontal strokes, curvilinear descenders, open and closed counters, pointing mainly in distinct dots.
Layout: Written in 21 lines per page.

Collation: 4 V(40), II (44), III (50), 5 V(100), 2 IV(116), i ; chiefly quinions ; catchwords present ; quire numbering in the form of Hindu-Arabic numerals on the opening recto of each quire, begins again with Sharḥ Muqaddimat al-Sanūsī ; pagination in pencil, Western numerals, supplied during digitization (includes inserts).
8. p.205-p.235 : Sharḥ al-taṣawwurāt wa-al-taṣdīq fī al-ʻaqāʼid / Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-Sanūsī.
6. p.93-p.203 : Sharḥ Muqaddimat al-Sanūsī al-musammāh bi-Umm al-barāhīn / Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-Sanūsī.
5. p.92 [ʻAqīdah ṣaghīrah] / Muḥammad Ibn ʻArrāq [Shams al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān Ibn ʻArrāq al-Kinānī].
4. p.90-p.91 : al-Fawāʼid / Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-Sanūsī.
3. p.10-p.89 : Kitāb Sharḥ al-Sanūsīyah al-ṣughrá / Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-Sanūsī.
2. p.6-p.9: al-Muqaddimah al-ṣughrá / Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-Sanūsī.
1. p.5 : [opening 'title page' with contents listing, waqf statement, etc.].
Velkov, Asparouh. Les Filigranes dans les documents Ottomans: divers types d’images. Sofia: Éditions "Texte - A. Trayanov", 2005.

Fine collection (majmūʻah) of several doctrinal treatises on the essentials of faith by Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-Sanūsī (d.1490) along with a brief creed attributed to Shams al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān Ibn ʻArrāq [ʻIrāq] al-Kinānī (d.1526). Contents listing on upper board lining (likely in Yahuda's hand) and on opening 'title page' (p.5).
Acquired in 1926 from the bookseller Isaac Benjamin S.E. Yahuda via purchase transacted on his behalf by Abraham Shalom Yahuda (1877-1951), his younger brother.

On opening 'title page' (p.5), waqf statement accompanied by circular seal impression (likely dated 1167 [1753 or 4]) in name of al-Ḥājj Muḥammad Saʻīd ( الحاج محمد سعيد ), statement reads "وقد وقفت هذا المجموع وقفا صحيحا مرعيا شرائطه وانا الفقير الحاج محمد سعيد" ; on p.93 and p.205, repeated waqf statements in name of the aforementioned al-Ḥājj Muḥammad Saʻīd ( الحاج محمد سعيد ) each accompanied by his seal ; collation / correction / audition statement at close of Sharḥ Umm al-barāhīn (p.203) dated 27 Rabīʻ II 1120 [ca. 16 July 1708], indicated the text was read in the hearing of al-Mullā Ilyās, statement reads "بلغ هذا الشرح مقابلة وتصحيحا وقرأة على الاستاذ الملا الياس وختمناه عليه يوم الاحد السابع وعشرين من شهر ربيع الثاني سنة ۱۱۲۰" ; glosses and marginal corrections ; collation notes.
Kinānī, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn ʻArrāq,
Sharḥ Muqaddimat al-Sanūsī al-musammāh bi-Umm al-barāhīn
شرح مقدمة السنوسي المسماة بام البراهين
كناني, محمد بن علي بن عراق.
